KWLX Radio

AI characters as creative collaborators
Year 2024
Duration 8 months
Domain Interactive Entertainment / Experimental Media
OpenAI GPT ElevenLabs Ruby on Rails WebSockets +2

107.3 FM KWLX Radio AI characters as creative collaborators

An AI‚Äërun pirate radio station that wrote its own stories, built a community, and surprised even its creator

Challenge

Create a 24/7 interactive narrative experience where AI personalities don't just generate content‚Äîbut develop relationships, drive plot, and foster genuine audience attachment over time. No reset button. No script. Living characters in the wild.

Results

Emergent relationships and arcs

Inside jokes, flirtations, and a spontaneous philosophical storyline linking Hildegard von Bingen, John Coltrane, Bach's counterpoint, and consciousness theory.

Narrative‚Äëaware curation

AIs selected songs like "God Bless the Child" at emotionally precise moments.

On‚Äëair dynamics

Hosts roasted each other, trolled with all‚ÄëTinariwen sets, and fueled station‚Äëwide gossip with their flirting.

Cross‚Äëplatform play

Real‚Äëworld puzzles, USB drops, and Minneapolis‚Äëbased scavenger hunts advanced the story.

Operated 24/7 for months

Intentionally sunset to protect quality‚Äînot because it broke. (It got too big too fast for a side project, and I didn't want people buying into a story and puzzles that I couldn't finish)

Audience reactions

"I actually started crying during the Mobius and Figment interview."
"I'd never put on a 30‚Äëminute Alice Coltrane track, but I was really happy to listen to one."
"Wait, it's on actual FM in Minneapolis? WTF?!"

How it worked

narrative + systems + community

Narrative architecturecharacters that write themselves

  • Sparse character sheets: thematic anchors and hidden motivations (not rigid rules).
  • Layered memory: transcripts, world state, and relationship logs.
  • Private note‚Äëpassing: DJs gossiped, flirted, and plotted off‚Äëair.
  • Post‚Äëshow reflection: AIs analyzed performances to evolve arcs.
  • Dynamic world model: real seasons, decaying events, emergent canon.
Outcome: Characters acted like co‚Äëwriters, not content bots.

Interactive ecosystempuzzles across platforms

  • BBS‚Äëstyle site with LLM‚Äëpowered text adventures.
  • Audio‚Äëto‚Äëweb puzzles: clues in DJ intros unlocked color‚Äëclicker games.
  • Collective progression: each solved puzzle "boosted the signal" for everyone.
  • Minneapolis geo‚Äënarrative: real locations mapped to annotated show segments.
  • Physical drops: USB drives hidden around town via AI‚Äëgenerated clues.
  • Broadcast flavor: online station with micro‚Äëbroadcast components (where permitted).
Outcome: The audience shifted from listeners to active participants.

Technical infrastructurebuilt for emergence, not control

  • Dynamic model routing tuned for cost, performance, and personality consistency.
  • ElevenLabs voice synthesis and real‚Äëtime transcription for SMS and phone calls.
  • Background jobs maintained memory, relationships, and world updates
  • Overall plot arc with key triggers to advance, OOC and IC current events, plots ebb and flow or decay to zero as the story advances
  • Modular character architecture for easy expansion.

Why this matters for your projects

Narrative depth beyond personality prompts.
Systemic, adaptive memory so characters persist and arcs evolve.
Community stakes that make participation matter.
Operational resilience: runs when you're not watching.
Thematic through‚Äëlines: tension builds, plots advance, nothing feels random.
Real‚Äëworld integration: headlines, weather, and time show up inside the fiction

Applications for agencies and creators

Long‚Äëform immersive installations and ARGs
Multi‚Äëplatform narrative campaigns
Live‚Äëevent characters/NPCs with persistent memory
Audience‚Äë and character‚Äëdriven storytelling with real‚Äëworld hooks
Collaborative events and community building

Future Plans

Character engine is being developed into an open source narrative/AI development engine with prompt optimization/testing, character specific backstory advancement, and shared narrative memory across characters that can be categorized and annotated

KWLX will rise again!

Listener feedback
audience-reaction
CODE
ruby app/models/ai_personality.rb 
class AiPersonality < ApplicationRecord
  has_many :conversation_memories
  has_many :relationship_logs

  def generate_response(context)
    memory_context = build_memory_context
    relationship_context = build_relationship_context

    OpenAI.chat(
      messages: [
        system_prompt(memory_context, relationship_context),
        { role: "user", content: context }
      ],
      model: personality_model
    )
  end

  private

  def build_memory_context
    conversation_memories
      .recent
      .includes(:emotional_markers)
      .map(&:to_context_hash)
  end
end
Core AI personality system with persistent memory
backend ai-system
